messages.title: The Only Candidate Who Lives and Works in the Constituency
messages.content: Liz Pole is highlighted as the only candidate who lives and works in the constituency, emphasizing her connection to the area.

messages.title: Only Labour Can Beat the Tories Here!
messages.content: The leaflet asserts that only a vote for Labour can beat the Conservatives in the Tiverton & Honiton constituency, based on the 2017 general election results.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: The leaflet promises more investment in schools and no more cuts.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Tackle the NHS and social care crisis
keyPolicies.policyDescription: It mentions ending NHS privatisation, more doctors and nurses, and free personal care for over-65s.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Fight climate change and create jobs
keyPolicies.policyDescription: The leaflet talks about kick-starting a Green Industrial Revolution to tackle climate change and create skilled jobs.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Labour came second in 2017 in Tiverton & Honiton with 15,670 votes, over three times as many as the Liberal Democrats. Only a vote for Labour can beat the Tories here.

issues.education: Fairer funding for education - promising more investment in schools and no more cuts.
issues.environment: Fight climate change and create jobs - kick-starting a Green Industrial Revolution to tackle climate change and create skilled jobs.
issues.health: Tackle the NHS and social care crisis - ending NHS privatisation, more doctors and nurses, and free personal care for over-65s.

leaflet.personalStatement: My pledges to you: To listen to you and be accessible, to campaign tirelessly for the issues that matter to you, and represent Tiverton & Honiton with passion and integrity.

contactInformation.address: 2 Banthill House, South Street, Axminster EX13 5AD

endorsements.endorsement: An individual endorses Liz citing her experience as a listening representative, fighting for the constituency's interests.

quotes.text: Labour came a strong second in 2017 in Tiverton & Honiton with 15,670 votes, over three times as many as the Liberal Democrats. Only a vote for Labour can beat the Tories here.

images.caption: Liz Pole pictured standing outside a tractor, representing her work in the constituency
